segment.source: Use the Group Policy setting, Set a default associations configuration file, to set the default browser for your company devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: Use the Group Policy setting, Set a default associations configuration file, to set the default browser for your company devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: Set the default browser using Group Policy (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Set the default browser using Group Policy (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Set the default browser using Group Policy
segment.target: Set the default browser using Group Policy

segment.source: You can use the Group Policy setting, Set a default associations configuration file, to set the default browser for your company devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: You can use the Group Policy setting, Set a default associations configuration file, to set the default browser for your company devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: To set the default browser as Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: To set the default browser as Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the Administrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsFile ExplorerSet a default associations configuration file setting.
segment.target: Open your Group Policy editor and go to the Administrative TemplatesWindows ComponentsFile ExplorerSet a default associations configuration file setting.

segment.source: Turning this setting on also requires you to create and store a default associations configuration file, locally or on a network share.
segment.target: Turning this setting on also requires you to create and store a default associations configuration file, locally or on a network share.

segment.source: For more information about creating this file, see Export or Import Default Application Associations.
segment.target: For more information about creating this file, see Export or Import Default Application Associations.

segment.source: set default associations group policy setting
segment.target: set default associations group policy setting

segment.source: Click Enabled, and then in the Options area, type the location to your default associations configuration file.
segment.target: Click Enabled, and then in the Options area, type the location to your default associations configuration file.

segment.source: If this setting is turned on and your employee's device is domain-joined, this file is processed and default associations are applied at logon.
segment.target: If this setting is turned on and your employee's device is domain-joined, this file is processed and default associations are applied at logon.

segment.source: If this setting isn't configured or is turned off, or if your employee's device isn't domain-joined, no default associations are applied at logon.
segment.target: If this setting isn't configured or is turned off, or if your employee's device isn't domain-joined, no default associations are applied at logon.

segment.source: Your employees can change this setting by changing the Internet Explorer default value from the Set Default Programs area of the Control Panel.
segment.target: Your employees can change this setting by changing the Internet Explorer default value from the Set Default Programs area of the Control Panel.
